website_summaries.verdict: While they fall short of delivering truly excellent sound, the well-designed Philips Fidelio M1 on-ear headphones are comfortable to wear and well-suited for day-to-day use.
pros: The Philips Fidelio M1s offer clear, natural sound and a very comfortable fit for on-ear headphones
They also fold flat, have an attractive design, and have an inline one-button remote/microphone for making cell phone calls
A protective carrying pouch is included
cons: Sound comes across a little recessed

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones. I bought them on sale for cheap, four pairs and they are plenty good enough to awesome. Yeah, I have some better headphones but these are the ones that I end up using for casual listening. Light weight, comfortable, sound great. I'm a studio musician also so I have ears and these are more than fine, especially if you can still find them for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: hhilde

customer_reviews.title: Confort, desing, quality.
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I recommend this excellent headphones! The construction is very well performed, with fine materials. Are very confortable, the desing is excellent. The sound quality is excellent. Strong bass, very clear mediums and bright trebles. You can connect to a protable device like celphone and get high volume and strong sound because the sensibility are high and the impedance are low, only 16 ohms. The earmuffs are very comfortable and fit excellently. It has a very good isolation from outside noise. These Headphones are definitely PREMIUM!
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones for classical music and watching movies on an iPad.Bass is there when needed but some may find them lean in the bass dept.High quality materials,although,there are reports of pads easily damaged,supposedly,they are glued on seams,instead of stitched,other than that,well made.I would assume glue dries up or gets damaged by concentrated heat,so avoid leaving them in hot car etc.
customer_reviews.author: Blonde girl in wedges

customer_reviews.title: Much much better than the price suggests.
customer_reviews.text: These are an excellent pair of headphones, with very good audio fidelity. I bought mine for twice the price, and have now come back for a second pair. They're fantastic for mobile use, and do a nice job of isolating background noise with their closed architecture. While I usually prefer open architecture when out and about, I'm finding myself enjoying the isolation of a very solidly designed pair of closed cans.
customer_reviews.author: Milorad Ivovic

customer_reviews.title: Great over ear headset at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good set of headphone for the gym and after researching many site and reviews I came across the Philips M1's. I wanted something that would sound good with rock music and I found that headsets like beats are bass driven and distorts rock music. So for half the price this set delivers amazing sound quality, and yes there are better headsets that will cost way more but for the price these are better then I expected. The only negative is that when running you hear a thumping, so when I run I switch to to Koss 75 over ear headset.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ayala

customer_reviews.title: A few odd quirks, but great for sound
customer_reviews.text: PROS: The sound quality is fabulous. It sounds like a $200+ set with strong bass and clear trebles. The set is very comfortable to wear, even with my glasses on (at least for an hour or so of continuous wear). CONS: Not sure why the 3.5mm input is hanging off the headphone...I fear that it might get caught on something and rip off. The cable that it comes with is threaded and shielded, but doesn't unwind very well.
customer_reviews.author: foxfour

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but i'm picky
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Decent sound, i'd give sound 4/5 stars. - Great fit - Good outside insulation - Quality everything - Start/stop volume up/down control Cons - Trying to be fancy with the cable material makes it tough and not very flexible - A bit tight on the head so gives headache after a while - Not the best sound for the price
customer_reviews.author: Fares Ghandour

customer_reviews.title: but not much better. Build quality and fit are a definite 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: This is tough. For sound I would give them a 3, really muffled. I tried to burn them in for 4 days straight, but not much better. Build quality and fit are a definite 5 though, especially for the price. Just the sound was not that good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The cover of the cushions/earpads came off as poorly made. Despite low usage and good care. Quite disappointing Other than that good sound but a bit heavy and unconfortable if you wear glasses
customer_reviews.author: Riccardo Ribet

customer_reviews.title: Good sound
customer_reviews.text: Good sound and beautifully designed. Unfortunately I can't wear them for longer then 1 hour cause my ears start hurting. It's a little bit too tight... maybe it's my ears are too big :-)
customer_reviews.author: Beatriz Tadeia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sound!
customer_reviews.text: Wahou!!! What a great sound! More than happy of my purchase after several weeks of research. Highly recommended. Of course the "Perfect sound of the title will depend also about the music you are playing, the device you are using... But this is the best headphonew I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Romu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Headset! Great quality with exterior & sound.
customer_reviews.text: The best you can get for the half of the price you pay on the market. I love it, It's my second pair from Philips Fidelio style headphone. It's perfect for indoor and home theater enjoyment. Can't resist to get myself a third pair...
customer_reviews.author: TYLER WUCHUNTA

customer_reviews.title: Solid build quality. Works great for me.
customer_reviews.text: In brief, you'll feel that there were a bunch of pro designers worked on this product. Cords won't tangle. Great modern look. Has lots of metal, but not heavy. Puts a good amount of pressure on the ears, but very comfortable. Good sound. Nice job at noise-cancelling without any batteries, even at low volume. Haven't tested the microphone yet. Would've gotten a lot of press if it was an Apple product, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: amazipinions

customer_reviews.title: Nice build...okay sound... uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: They have a premium look to them but the sound is not any better than an HD 201. If you wear these any longer than 30 minutes your ears will hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Hankola

customer_reviews.title: they work great. He is hearing impaired
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Dad's iPad, they work great. He is hearing impaired. He loves them.
customer_reviews.author: S Salyer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, great for mid tones. Some songs, it feels refrained unless you EQ your source.
customer_reviews.author: GTBayArea

customer_reviews.title: BAD: - the little cable on the headphones is ...
customer_reviews.text: BAD: - the little cable on the headphones is a little annoying, and you need to raise the mic for calls GOOD: - great sound - excellent quality - replaceable cable is always god
customer_reviews.author: Lenin

customer_reviews.title: Really amazing sound quality and balance
customer_reviews.text: Really amazing sound quality and balance, good building quality. The comfort is not as good as I expected but I must admit I have a big, large head, it fits much better to more "normal" heads.
customer_reviews.author: Christophe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome headphone as it sounds way higher than its price point
customer_reviews.author: Wong Choong Cheok

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, build quality, high clamping force
customer_reviews.text: Clear sound, leather wrapped headband with aluminium rings. Clamping force is too high, not suitable for long hours wearing, ear pad is not replaceable. The ear pad leather keep on broken not due to careless usage, Philips products have infamous of bad durability. after one year usage, the ear cushion is totally broken, it is very troublesome to change. lousy, Philips!
customer_reviews.author: steven meng

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable when I first got it but the ear pads ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable when I first got it but the ear pads comes apart in a few month. Not made to last.
customer_reviews.author: EZ

customer_reviews.title: Nice style, great sound and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I think these headsets are really good value. I like the subdued but kind of expensive style. They sound really great compared to my old Senheisers but above all you can wear them for hours as they are so comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Dinh Doan Van Bien

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, block out exterior noise really well and ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound, block out exterior noise really well and build quality is great. The only negative (and its minor) is that the cups get warm on your ears.
customer_reviews.author: J Gillion

customer_reviews.title: Good sound with good price.
customer_reviews.text: However, the remote not fully support Android phone, just pause, play or skip. No volume control. Maybe it is an old version which support iphone.
customer_reviews.author: Fung Ping Tat

customer_reviews.title: good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: great build quality and it's good at rock and electronic music.overall good sound quality but a litter too tigh .
customer_reviews.author: SHE Chin pang

customer_reviews.title: Good on earphones for the commute
customer_reviews.text: The earphones give good isolation, have good enough sound, but makes my ears sweat a little in hot weather. Overall, I recomend!
customer_reviews.author: Valter Capeleiro

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality not that great
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable but sound quality us muddier than I expected - no where near the quality of the x1s I also bought.
customer_reviews.author: Bukowski

customer_reviews.title: Great and Worth it
customer_reviews.text: the sound is great, it's the best headphone for using outside. and also the price is not that expensive, so it worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jingnan yu

customer_reviews.title: Not good for working out.  Good tone.
customer_reviews.text: It sounds good, unless you run with it. Then it makes strange sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Low Hertz

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad buy, just a little uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, reliable mic and volume feature and a good build overall. However after extensive use the headphones start giving me a headache as they feel rather tight around the head. The drivers on these do deliver a very good sound experience for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: Atanas

customer_reviews.title: Just what the boy asked for
customer_reviews.text: Our son asked for these earphones for a Christmas present. Although he just got them and has not used them yet, I was impressed with the reviews and found them to be very helpful
customer_reviews.author: Jeri

customer_reviews.title: OUCH!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Supposedly these cans are some of the most comfortable on the market, but I would have to disagree. They put a huge amount of pressure on your head, and it was so uncomfortable that I could not stand it for more than a couple minutes. As I am writing this review I have a headache from the pressure. I can't comment on the sound quality because I didnt get that far into my music library as they were that uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: don't bother
customer_reviews.text: sound was poor and they were obviously already used and shipped after someone else already returned them. The only good thing I can say is that I went beyond the return period but i was still able to get partial credit.
customer_reviews.author: Pangloss

product_meta.title: Philips M1/28 Fidelio On-Ear Headphones with Remote and Mic - Black (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Philips Fidelio M1i on-ear headphones for iPhone, iPod, and iPad combine superior sound and comfort to deliver true-to-life music while you're on the move. Thanks to masterful engineering, you get superb noise isolation, true high-definition audio, and a light yet sturdy design.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Enjoy high-fidelity music from your iPod, iPhone, or iPad with the Fidelio M1 Headphones from Philips. These on-ear, headband-style headphones feature 40-millimeter speaker drivers for balanced performance along with an acoustic seal to stop leaks and preserve sound details. The ear pads have memory foam that adapts to the shape of your ear to increase comfort and seal in bass sounds. These headphones, designed for outdoor use, have double-layered ear shells and an oxygen-free, fabric-lined cable to ensure a high-quality signal.

 M1 headphones contain 40-millimeter drivers for balanced, natural sound.
View larger.

 Double-layered shells are designed for outdoor use. View larger.

 Hi-tech design for optimal audio.
View larger.

HIGH-DEFINITION SPEAKERS FOR BALANCED SOUND
 The Fidelio M1 headphones contain 40-millimeter speaker drivers that have been carefully tuned and tested to ensure balanced, natural sound. The drivers use high-power neodymium magnets to deliver high-definition sound in a wide dynamic range and reproduce minute details.

BASS REFLEX SYSTEM FOR CLEAR, DYNAMIC BASS
 The acoustic closed-back architecture of these headphones features a Bass Reflex System that includes double-layered ear shells with strategically placed vents and lightweight aluminum hinges. These regulate the air pressure within the internal chamber to isolate natural sound details and deliver precise, dynamic bass, even when you're listening to music outdoors.

ACOUSTIC SEAL KEEPS SOUND IN
 Built into the M1's internal chamber is a ribbon lock that serves as an acoustic seal to ensure noise isolation and eliminate any unnecessary sound leaks, preserving sound details for an optimal audio experience without compromising clarity.

TUNED FREQUENCY RESPONSE FOR FAITHFUL REPRODUCTION
 Philips acoustics engineers have tuned the Fidelio M1 headphones to achieve an optimal balance based on how listeners discern sound. Consequently, the headphones reproduce sound that is faithful to the original recording, offering a frequency response of 15,000 - 24,000 Hz.

DOUBLE-LAYERED EAR SHELLS REDUCE RESONANCE
 The Fidelio M1's double-layered ear shells are made to reduce resonance and dampen vibrations, resulting in precise and clean sound. In addition, their solid, layered construction provides durability and comfort. The fine-stitched headband is made of real leather.

BREATHABLE EAR PADS WITH MEMORY FOAM
 The Fidelio M1 headphones come equipped with breathable ear pads and memory foam that adapts to the shape of your ear to seal in bass sounds and keep out ambient noise. As a result, you can enjoy a comfortable, ergonomic fit and wear the headphones for long periods of time.

INCLUDES CONVENIENT IN-LINE REMOTE
 With the Apple-compatible in-line remote and microphone, you can switch tracks, adjust volume, and take calls without taking off your headphones or taking your mobile device out of your pocket. The oxygen-free, fabric-lined cable ensures a high-quality signal.

PRODUCT INFORMATION
 These headphones are compatible with the iPhone (3GS, 4, and 4S), iPod classic (120 GB and 160 GB), iPod nano (4th, 5th, and 6th generations), iPod touch (2nd, 3rd, and 4th generations), iPod shuffle (3rd and 4th generations), the iPad, and the iPad 2. They measure 7.1 by 6.5 by 1.7 inches (H x W x D) and weigh 0.37 pounds.

ABOUT PHILIPS
 With a proud history in technology, including the invention of the compact audio tape cassette and the CD, Philips is committed to understanding and meeting the needs and desires of consumers. With over 50,000 registered patents, Philips is a global leader in innovation, receiving numerous international design and acoustics awards every year.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
 Philips Fidelio M1 Headphones, in-line remote and microphone, and storage pouch.

FIDELIO M1 HEADPHONES
AT A GLANCE:
 * 40-millimeter drivers with neodymium magnets
 * Bass Reflex System for precise, dynamic bass
 * Double-layered ear shells reduce resonance and vibrations
 * Breathable ear pads and memory foam adapts to your ear shape
 * Oxygen-free, fabric-lined cable ensures high-quality signal

 In-line remote provides convenient controls. View larger.

 Breathable ear pads and memory foam adapts to your ear shape. View larger.

PHILIPS FIDELIO HEADPHONES
